alert.note: Alert for Central Plaquemines; Coastal Jefferson; Eastern Orleans; Lower Jefferson; Lower Lafourche; Lower Plaquemines; Lower St. Bernard; Lower Terrebonne; St. Charles; Upper Jefferson; Upper Lafourche; Upper Plaquemines; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 10 at 1:57AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF ST. BERNARD, SOUTHEASTERN ST. CHARLES, ORLEANS, SOUTHEASTERN TERREBONNE, SOUTHEASTERN LAFOURCHE, JEFFERSON AND PLAQUEMINES PARISHES THROUGH 330 AM CST... At 156 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Slidell to near Cocodrie. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Chalmette, Cut Off, Galliano, Larose, Marrero, Harvey, East New Orleans, Timberlane, Belle Chasse, Port Sulphur, Gretna, Golden Meadow, Jean Lafitte, Lake Catherine, Empire, Poydras, Port Fourchon, Myrtle Grove, and Pointe A La Hache. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 240 and 256. Interstate 510 between mile markers 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
